Articles.Content:
Hi,

I made a Shenzhou in ksp.

This is a mini version with only one kerbal, instead of the real one with seats for three.

The Shenzhou is the chinese Soyuz. China modified a russian Soyuz and came up with the Shenzhou. The Shenzhou is slightly bigger and have more electrical power than the Soyuz.

IMPORTANT Hotkeys

2: This closes the intakes on the capsule and lower the drag.

3: Deploys the solararrays on the servicemodule and the orbitalmodule.

Enter: Activate launch escape system and decouple the capsule from the rocket.

0: Decouple capsule from launch escape system and deploy the chute.

Sitting on the pad.

Shenzhou in all its glory.

The launch escape system in action.

More pictures can be found here: http://imgur.com/a/rzwCQ#0

Download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/1ss5fz4jrhg52su/Shenzhou%20%2B%20Long%20March%202F%20v2.craft

Edited June 14, 2013 by 1612
And I thought my mini soyuz was good. I will give it a tuch up and maybe add a screenshot in a later post!

If I'm right the first 2F and 3F rockets both blew up killing a total of over 500 people (2F blew up above launch pad and 3F ended up flying into a village and killing some 500 people). But good work though

If I'm right the first 2F and 3F rockets both blew up killing a total of over 500 people (2F blew up above launch pad and 3F ended up flying into a village and killing some 500 people). But good work though

Yeah you're right.
This looks like a great rocket why hasn't anyone commented on it? I would be proud if I built this!

I really like it, but when looking at a Longmarch 2F isn't the payload fairing as wide as the centre stack itself?

Maybe using 2m parts would have been more realistic since you could fit a 1m payload then.

A great looking rocket none the less.

Meh it's pretty ugly and impractical.

Are you just saying that because it's of Chinese design?
The Shenzhou is not a modified Soyuz. It is based off of it and is slightly bigger than the Soyuz.
